moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Nc3: A four-knights game, I hate this! It's not agressive enough...
moves.3... Nf6 4. Bc4: An Italian way of it, Bb5 is also possible, but then you have a Spanish variation of the FKG.
moves.4... Bc5 5. d3 d6 6. Bg5: The first really active move, it's a normal one, but Nd5 is threatening...
moves.6... Na5 7. Qd2: People normally play Bb3, but this is not a bad one, he receives the semi-open d-file.
moves.9. Bxf6: An odd move, you don't give your best piece for a stupid night!
moves.9... Qxf6 10. O-O-O: If he would play Qg5, I can exange and I have the pair of the bishops, and I win the f2-pawn.
moves.11. Qe2 Rd8: Defending my weakest link, the d-pawn.
moves.12. Kb1: I'll never understand this move. He didn't play to win.
moves.12... O-O 13. Na4: Trying to exange the night for the bishop.
moves.13... Bb4 14. a3 Ba5 15. c5: It seems to be a good move, but if look good, you see the weaknesses he gives to white. For example: my bishop on e6 has a huge power! He became a killing spree! He will also deliver me of my weakness on d6.
moves.16... Qe7 17. Rhd1 b5: This is a good move, I obligate him to take on e6!
moves.18. cxd6 Bxd6: Now my both bishops are killing sprees.
moves.19. Nc3 Rd7: Want to go to the b-file with my rook.
moves.20. Qe3 h6: Don't want to exange the bishop for that night, so h6 is in this case an acceptable move.
moves.21. Rd2d3: Want to go with the queen to d2, but I win a tempo.
moves.24. axb4 Rxb4 25. g5: Who will be the first to have a really strong attack?
moves.25... Rxb2+: It will be me, this is a powerfull move who kills my poor opponent...
moves.26. Ka1: after 26. Kxb2 Ba3  27. Ka1 Bb2 !! 28. Kxb2 Qb4  he also doesn't have any chance...
moves.26... Bb8: An important move, all the rest loses! (because there will be Rxd6!)
moves.27. Nd5 Ra2+ 28. Kb1 Rb7+ 29. Qb3 Qa3: And now he gave up! I hope you have enjoyed this game!

players: Schouteeten Stefaan  vs. Van den Heede Dorian (1686)
